protein.specific_function: Responsible for the biosynthesis of pyroglutamyl peptides. Has a bias against acidic and tryptophan residues adjacent to the N-terminal glutaminyl residue and a lack of importance of chain length after the second residue. Also catalyzes N-terminal pyroglutamate formation. In vitro, catalyzes pyroglutamate formation of N-terminally truncated form of APP amyloid-beta peptides [Glu-3]-beta-amyloid. May be involved in the N-terminal pyroglutamate formation of several amyloid-related plaque-forming peptides.

go_class.description: peptidyl-pyroglutamic acid biosynthetic process, using glutaminyl-peptide cyclotransferase

reference.reference_text: Song I, Chuang CZ, Bateman RC Jr: Molecular cloning, sequence analysis and expression of human pituitary glutaminyl cyclase. J Mol Endocrinol. 1994 Aug;13(1):77-86.
